resources.string: Nice to meet you, this is ZeroMirror.

This app is an app to share the screen (mirroring).
 You can share the screen of this smartphone from a computer or smartphone connected to the same Wi-Fi.
 To use it, just open the URL in the browser of another terminal.
 It is a specification that there is a momentary reading when switching images (WebSocket Mode).
Update frequency, bit rate and FPS settings
I...? ,\n It\'s a simple screen sharing (mirroring) application that requires only a browser.
You can see it from your browser
Do you really want to reset
Shortening it will reduce the delay with the video played in the browser.
The image quality should improve at the cost of increasing the size of the video.
If you are using Android 10 or later, you will be able to combine the audio of your device with the video. Requires microphone privileges.
Basically, you can keep the default.
You can see a little explanation about this app.
You can see the screen sharing by entering this URL in the address field of the browser of your PC or smartphone.
Android 10 and above can share internal audio
You can include internal audio in your screen share. Microphone permission is required to include internal audio.
(Cannot be used because the microphone authority is not granted)
If not specified, the screen resolution will be used.

Recommendation.
 Mirroring is performed using a technology called MPEG-DASH, which is also used in live distribution.
 The video codec uses VP9, the audio codec uses Opus, and the container uses WebM.
 Requires a browser with the MediaSource Extensions API available.
Mirroring is performed by transmitting the chopped video with WebSocket.\n The video codec is H.264, the audio codec is AAC, and the container is MP4.
Can display mirroring information in notification area
Android 13 and higher now require permission to send notifications. You can use it without authorization, but you can display the IP address and QR code in the notification area.
MPEG-DASH mode only. For those who don\'t have a VP9 encoder.
Mirror the output of your external display
For apps that support external display output, mirror the output of the external display instead of mirroring the device.
Behavior when connected to an external display
Settings changed during mirroring, so exited.

The app is currently not displayed on the screen.
 (Another app is displayed on the screen)
 
 Once the app appears on the screen,
 Mirroring will resume.

Partial screen sharing is now supported starting with Android 14 QPR2.\n It is now possible to mirror only the specified app part instead of the entire screen.\n Status bar and notifications are not reflected!
